=Windows=
[http://raptor.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/windows.png] Download the windows installer, and follow the setup instructions.
Go to the [http://code.google.com/p/raptor/downloads/list?q=label:Featured download page] or directly [http://code.google.com/p/raptor/downloads/detail?name=raptor-0.4.0-setup.exe get the last release]

=Linux=
 =[http://raptor.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ubuntu.png] Ubuntu =
 You can get a binary ubuntu package from the repository since lucid lynx. Just add the repository following one of these two methods:
  * Add the repository using the add-apt-repository command
{{{
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:raptor-project/raptor
}}}
  * Or just edit your _sources.list_ file and import the key.
{{{
#sudo apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 8B87FA0A 
deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/raptor-project/raptor/ubuntu oneiric main
}}}
 Then install raptor
{{{
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install raptor-editor
}}}

 The deb package for ubuntu are also available on the [http://code.google.com/p/raptor/downloads/list?q=label:Featured download page]

 =[http://raptor.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/fedora.png] Fedora =
 raptor is not yet available via yum, but you can get the rpm for fedora on the [http://code.google.com/p/raptor/downloads/list?q=label:Featured download page]

 Then install raptor
{{{
sudo rpm -ivh raptor-editor-(your_version).rpm
}}}

 =[http://raptor.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/linux.png] Others distributions =

 No binary packages are available yet for your distribution. _(contributions are welcomed)._

 Get the source and compile it. See the [BuildingRaptor How to build raptor] wiki page.
 
=Mac OS=
[http://raptor.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/mac.png] No binary packages are available for Mac OS . _(contributions are welcomed)._
 Get the source and compile it. See the [BuildingRaptor How to build raptor] wiki page.
